front.title: Virtual Interface Support for IP Hosts

abstract.t: A Virtual Interface is a software semantic internal to the hostoperating system. This semantic is widely available in all popularoperating systems and is used in various protocol implementations.The Virtual Interface support is also required on the mobile nodeoperating in a Proxy Mobile IPv6 domain, for leveraging variousmobility features such as inter-technology handoffs, multihoming andflow mobility support. This document explains the operationaldetails of Virtual Interface construct and the inter-working with thenetwork elements in the Proxy Mobile IPv6 domain for supportingvarious network-based mobility management features.
